I don't have access to the latest updates or recent trends in architecture, but i can tell you that recent constructions in erode have also tried to incorporate traditional design elements and maintain the city's cultural heritage.

one of the examples is the massive and impressive perundurai medical college and hospital which has been constructed using a mix of traditional and modern architectural styles. the hospital building blends the modern architectural elements with the traditional dravidian style, with multiple arches and domes adorning the building's exteriors.

another modern building in erode is the erode district court complex. the court complex features contemporary architectural design using glass, steel, and granite while at the same time integrating traditional architectural elements like arched windows, a common feature of tamil nadu's dravidian architecture.

even in the residential architecture of erode, you can find a mix of traditional and modern designs. many modern houses in the city still incorporate certain traditional elements like the red-tiled sloping roofs and intricate moldings in the corners and doorways.

these modern buildings reflect a respectful combination of tradition and modernity while keeping the city's cultural heritage alive.
